result.execSummary:
The defendant Falon P Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

Be involved in a parenting class or a one on one program with a therapist. Comply with family court order. Probation maybe transfered to Illinois. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Falon P Sims in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Plea to count 1 as amended to Battery & count 2 Disorderly Conduct. 
Rights Given
P- NC 
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1 as amended & count 2.

Count 1- Withheld sentence, 1 year probation

Count 2- Withheld sentence, 1 year probation

Conditions:
Be involved in a parenting class or one on one program with a therapist
Comply with family court order
Provide DNA Sample + pay surcharge 
Waive court costs
Probation maybe transfered to the State of Illinois
